pros: amazing professors, lots of one on one attention
cons: lots of hard work, financially hard

job_title: Campus Safety Officer in Cazenovia, NY
pros: Family atmosphere, small campus, good time off.
People there were awesome to work eith as well as the students who came to the school.
cons: Distribution of jobs wasn't always fair and not the best benefits.

pros: Cazenovia is a tight-knit community centered on helping student success. Anyone who teaches there does so because providing individualized instruction, though often time-intensive, is very rewarding. Students and alumni are very loyal, as are employees.
cons: Pay has been below industry standards in all positions.

pros: Flexibility, good people, freedom to build skills and programs
cons: Low budgets, people stretched too thin, so organizational issues and lots of inefficiency

pros: Know each other and very flexible and supportive to do something.
cons: Not competitive compensation. But I am not full time employee, so not sure

job_title: Dining Hall Assistant in Brooklyn, NY
pros: The managers try to work around your class schedule.  The managers are usually easy to talk to, you can even joke around with them most of the time. Because Cazenovia College is a small college, you most likely already know the staff, which may or may not be a benefit depending on who you are working with. One day you may be working with a friend, the next someone you dislike.
cons: Sometimes the students may become difficult to deal with. They may be impatient or feel entitled to something. You are given a minimum of 5 hours or so, so you can only get a 15 minute break. It can become difficult to get your gloves off, get the utensils, wait on the line, get your food, then drink, find a seat, and finally be able to eat all in the span of 15 minutes. Shifts are not always given generously but that may be due to there being over 50 part timer students to divide shifts to. Some of my coworkers were lazy and I hope for a better staff for the upcoming school year.

review_title: Room to improve in a lot of areas
pros:
- Close knit community
 - Flexible vacation and sick time
 - Open work environment with opportunity to try new ideas
 - Everyone here works for the students benefit first.
cons:
- Enrollment issues
- low salaries
- Benefit costs increase each year with no raises in sight
- Little to no retirement contribution
- Not a lot of room for advancement

pros:
- Easy, laid back environment
- Freedom of speech 
- Co-workers are friends in and out of the workplace
- Dependable, flexible and friendly
cons: - The ICT Dept. has zero downsides in my opinion. They try very hard and are always open to help anyone and everyone in whatever way possible even at the expense of their own personal time.

pros: Small student body comprised of average to below average students with a diverse array of interests and talents.
cons: Behind the scenes off the record toxic gossip mill environment.  High administrative turn over, anti union atmosphere in a place that would certainly benefit from an organized voice.

review_title: Executive Secretary to the Dean of Academics
job_title: Executive Administrative Assistant in Cazenovia, NY
pros: Excellent working environment, great people, family friendly.
cons: Winter driving to the college can be an adventure.

pros: The kids were kind and were like no other college I taught at
cons: The parking was a bit far

pros: Room and part of board paid for.
Small sized student body moderate retention.
cons: Inconsistent managerial leadership, high turn over.
